body.p: Your petitioners would respectfully represent that David Boner and Joseph Hendricks were at the present Oct Term of the Pendleton Circuit Court found guilty by the verdict of a jury of breaking into the store house of Thomas Wheeler in the County of Pendleton with intent to commit a fellony. They are mere boys, have always sustained a good character, and whether guilty or not your petitioners believe that their pardon, would be promotive of their reformation. They are respectfully connected: no other charge has ever been brought or prefered against them. Your petitioners, with strong assurances from the accused of th reformation, respectfully request your Exellency to pardon them.

I with A. G. Roberts defended the young men who have petitioned for Executive clemency. They are respectably connected: are quite young and I believe their pardon would have the effect to reform them if guilty. L. F. Throope
I endorse the statements of Maj Throope A G Roberts

E J Rawlings
S. Tho. Hauser
J. S. Coleman
T E Moore
The undersigned, who were jurors in the case above mentioned unite with the petitoners for the pardon of David Boner & Joseph Hendricks
